Ad Text:
Senior Business Analyst - Finance Transformation

Location: Sydney, NSW (Hybrid - 3 days per week in office)
Contract Type: Day Rate Contract


About the Role

We're seeking a driven and experienced Senior Business Analyst to join a finance transformation program within the financial services sector. This is a business-focused role - not a technology BA position - suited to someone with domain knowledge and a track record of delivering change across finance processes, reporting, and controls.

The successful candidate will play a key role in shaping and delivering improvements to processes, and systems, working closely with finance stakeholders to drive meaningful transformation.


Key Responsibilities
Partner with finance teams to analyse, document, and optimise business processes and workflows.

Lead requirements gathering and process mapping for finance transformation initiatives (e.g. GL, reporting, reconciliations, controls).

Define and document current-state and target-state processes, identifying improvement opportunities.

Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure business needs are captured and solutions are fit-for-purpose.

Support delivery and implementation of finance process and system changes (in partnership with technology where needed).

Develop and maintain business documentation including BRDs, process maps, test scripts, and training materials.

Support UAT, business readiness, and post-implementation review activities.

Provide actionable insights and recommendations to enhance finance efficiency and accuracy.

About You
Proven BA Expertise: Extensive experience as a Business Analyst, preferably within the banking or financial services sector.
Agile Environment Proficiency: Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an Agile environment, with strong skills in writing clear user stories, defining acceptance criteria, and managing a product backlog.
Core Analytical Skills: Master of core BA disciplines, including requirements elicitation and management, process mapping (As-Is/To-Be), gap analysis, and creating detailed business requirements documentation.
BA Practice Development: Ability to contribute to the establishment and maturity of the BA practice within the Finance transformation program by championing best practices, standardising templates, and potentially mentoring other BAs.
Business-Technology Liaison: Act as the vital bridge between business stakeholders and technical delivery teams, translating business needs into clear, actionable requirements without requiring deep technical expertise.
Stakeholder Management & Communication: Exceptional stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to manage expectations, facilitate workshops, and support change management and communications activities across the program.
End-to-End Testing Leadership: Responsibility for the business testing lifecycle, including preparing UAT scenarios and test cases, training business users for execution, and leading the UAT process to ensure solutions meet business requirements.
Independent & Proactive Drive: A proactive self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and demonstrates strong initiative and a drive to achieve successful outcomes.
Ways of Working: Proven ability to collaborate effectively as part of a team and work independently when required. You must have an open, honest, and proactive communication style.
Desirable Financial Domain Knowledge: Experience in Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), including budgeting, forecasting, and performance reporting processes, is highly desirable.
Desirable Systems & Transformation Experience: Experience with enterprise planning platforms such as Anaplan, TM1, or Hyperion is a significant plus, and experience with digital transformation, especially in finance, is highly desirable.
Contract Details
Start: ASAP

Duration: permanent or day rate contract

Rate: Competitive bonus (commensurate with experience)

Location: Sydney CBD / Hybrid (3 days in office, 2 days remote)


Candidates MUST have full Australian work rights to be considered for this position.

Business Analyst - Financial Services
Location: Sydney 3 days p.w office attendance
12M day rate contract
$700-$800 p.d plus super
Are you an experienced Business Analyst with a passion for driving process improvement and delivering real business outcomes? We're looking for a mid-level BA to join a high performing team within the banking sector.


About the Role

In this role, you'll partner with stakeholders across business and technology to define requirements, map processes, and support the delivery of strategic initiatives. You'll play a key role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions - ensuring clear communication, alignment, and measurable outcomes.


Key Responsibilities
Gather, document, and validate business requirements and user stories
Analyse and map current and future-state processes
Identify opportunities for process improvement and operational efficiency
Collaborate with technical teams to translate business needs into functional solutions
Facilitate workshops, interviews, and stakeholder engagement sessions
Support project delivery through testing, documentation, and change management
About You

You're a confident communicator who can translate complex ideas into clear, actionable requirements. You have a solid grounding in business analysis best practices and an understanding of banking environments.

You'll bring:


4-6 years' experience as a Business Analyst (retail or business banking experience is a must)
Strong process mapping and analysis skills
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities
Experience with Agile or hybrid delivery methodologies
Proven ability to work collaboratively across business and technical teams
Why Join Us?
Be part of a supportive, collaborative team
Work on meaningful projects that drive customer and business value
Enjoy flexible work arrangements and ongoing professional development opportunities

If you're a motivated BA who thrives on solving problems, improving processes, and communicating with impact - we'd love to hear from you.There are no sponsorship options, and the role is suited for a mid-level BAs only.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, and candidates must be based in Sydney for consideration.

About the Department
A small, dynamic federal agency with national reach. Renowned for high‑quality grants administration, strong governance, and evidence‑based program delivery. Supports research and innovation across multiple disciplines.
 
About the role
You will lead development of program logic models, theory of change, performance measures and evaluation planning. The role provides strategic advice, facilitates workshops, and works closely with senior stakeholders to ensure programs are coherent, measurable and aligned to organisational strategy.
 
Duties

Build program logic models and data matrices
Translate policy into clear causal pathways
Advise on design, measures, risks and evaluation
Lead workshops to build shared understanding
Develop monitoring and evaluation plans
 
Skills & experience

Expertise in program logic and evaluation methods
Strong analytical and critical thinking capability
Skilled facilitator with strong stakeholder influence
High‑level written communication and diagramming
Ability to manage complexity and work autonomously
  
How to apply
Apply directly or for more information on this role, please email Deb Moss at deb.moss@calleo.com.au

Calleo is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all people including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

About the Department
A small, dynamic federal agency with national reach. Known for high‑quality grants administration, research policy expertise and strong governance capability. Delivers major grant programs supporting diverse research across Australia.

About the role
You will lead the design and rollout of a new assurance framework, uplift grants management processes, and provide strategic advice on governance and risk. The role works closely with senior leaders, internal teams and external stakeholders to embed consistent, transparent assurance practices.
 
Duties

Build and implement assurance framework, tools and guidance
Advise on assurance maturity and control effectiveness
Strengthen grants processes at award activity level
Coordinate assurance reviews and audit planning
Analyse data to identify trends, gaps and improvements
 
Skills & experience

Experience in assurance, governance, audit and risk frameworks
Knowledge of Commonwealth grants, PGPA and APS governance
Strong analytical and judgement capability
Ability to influence stakeholders and manage sensitive issues
Clear, persuasive written communication in assurance contexts
  
How to apply
Apply directly or for more information on this role, please email Deb Moss at deb.moss@calleo.com.au
Calleo is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage applications from all people including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

Senior Data Scientist

About Us:

Jemena is an Australian energy company who own and operate more than $12.4 Billion worth of gas and electricity transportation assets across Australia supplying millions of households and businesses with these essential services every day.

We pride ourselves on our innovative approach, technical expertise, and dedication to safety, quality, and sustainability. Our Group’s over 3000 team members; consistently strive to make a difference in the communities we serve. 

About the role

Are you a skilled and motivated Senior Data Scientist with a passion for developing high-performance software applications and driving data-driven decision-making?

We are seeking a talented individual to join our dynamic team and play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to fuel our organisations growth. 

Develop software applications to support data-driven and efficient management of the Jemena Electricity Network, such as network modelling and visualisation.
Collaborate closely with Asset Management Engineers, Operational personnel, and IT staff responsible for real-time IT systems (SCADA, AMI, OMS, DMS), and platforms.
Play an integral role in enhancing data-driven decision-making and optimizing the operation of the Jemena Electricity Network. 

A little about you:

Ideally you will have the following:

Ideally an Electrical Engineering, Data Analytics or Computer Science degree with a sound understanding of electricity network distribution and advanced metering technologies.
Significant experience in writing and maintaining high performance, multicore applications in R and Python/PySpark.
Significant experience in developing advanced analytics applications such as real time analytics and machine learning.
Significant experience in leading software design, development and lifecycle management in a team environment.
Proficiency in Unix, HTML, SQL. Databricks, and AWS will be highly regarded along with working knowledge of various data analysis techniques and methodologies, such as time series analysis, forecasting, tree analysis, ML, vector & geospatial analysis.
Proficient in strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, adept at presenting complex information concisely. 

Qualifications:

Degree in Engineering, Data Analytics, or Computing Science.
Post graduate qualification in Data Analytics desirable.

Why you should come and work for us 

Our people are our energy source and we offer meaningful benefits and rewards that work for you. We offer the opportunity for long term career growth as part of our talent development and succession planning process. 

We are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we are part of. We welcome applications from people of all ages, backgrounds, abilities, and identities. At Jemena, you belong.

Organisation: 
We are partnering with a large, values-led institution with a long-standing presence and a modern, growth-oriented outlook. The organisation operates across multiple locations and portfolios and plays a significant role in supporting communities, skills development, and long-term economic outcomes.
Finance is a trusted partner to the business, not a back-office function. The team is embedded in strategic planning, investment decisions, and performance discussions, and is expected to challenge, influence and add value.

Position:
It is an opportunity to sit at the centre of strategy, performance, and governance within a large, multi-portfolio organisation with a complex operating environment and a meaningful public purpose.

As Financial Planning & Reporting Lead, you will partner closely with the CFO, Head of Commercial Finance, and senior executive leadership to shape financial direction, elevate decision-making, and strengthen the organisation’s medium- and long-term financial position. Your work will directly inform executive forums and governing bodies, influencing outcomes at the highest level.

Your remit will include:

Owning executive-level management reporting for senior leadership and governing committees, delivering concise, decision-ready insights
Leading medium-term financial strategy, including budgets, forecasts, scenario modelling, and risk analysis
Acting as a strategic partner to executive stakeholders across revenue planning, investment decisions, and performance management
Designing and improving planning, budgeting, and forecasting frameworks to increase accuracy, agility, and confidence in decision-making
Developing sophisticated financial models, costings, and business cases to support new initiatives and optimise resource allocation
Playing a leadership role in major system and reporting transformation initiatives, with a strong focus on automation and data integrity
Championing disciplined financial management, value-for-money principles, and continuous improvement across the organisation
Candidate:

CA or CPA qualification
Significant experience in FP&A within large, complex organisations (public sector or similar)
Industry experience in environments such as health, education, or service-based institutions
Advanced expertise in financial modelling, forecasting, and scenario analysis across large datasets and enterprise systems
A proven ability to prepare and present high-impact financial insights to executive leaders and governance forums
Strong commercial acumen, sound judgement, and the confidence to influence senior stakeholders
The ability to operate autonomously in ambiguous environments while maintaining rigour and attention to detail
How to apply:
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Will Nichols at wnichols@sharpandcarter.com.au
